page.title: 18ATTITUDES
page.content: The wet, misty weather which prevails for much of the year tends to nurture a stoic attitude within the local population. Change is not something which is welcomed in this part of the country and newcomers bear the label of 'Grockles' for many years after they first move in. People in the district are perhaps not so widely travelled as in other parts of Devon (perhaps there is some link here with the poor network of roads and the resulting difficulty in journeying to any of the county's major towns). Thus, there tends to be a very insular and parochial outlook. Superstition and folk-lore, therefore, still play a major part in the lives of local residents.
